color.$description:: Color tokens for the dark theme.

interactive.$description: The default color used for interactive elements.

subtle.$description: Use for actions that do not demand prominence, such as closing a modal or a navigation icon that is present on every view.

background.$description: Use for the background of interactive elements to ensure separation from the surface they appear on.

destructive.$description: Use to signify that an interaction will destroy something in the users' account or workflow.

disabled.$description: Use to signify that an interactive element is disabled.

secondary.$description: Use when a disabled element needs more than one shade.

critical.$description: Action required; user must see this status to be unblocked.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has critial status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a critical background.

warning.$description: Action may be required as a consequence of current state.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has warning status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a warning background.

success.$description: No action required; an action has completed successfully.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has success status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a success background.

informative.$description: No action required; but helpful to know about.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has informative status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop an informative background.

inactive.$description: No action required; not part of an active workflow.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has inactive status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop an inactive background.

heading.$description: Headings have high contrast against the application surface to cement their hierarchy.

text.$description: A slightly softer color is used for body text for greater readability.

secondary.$description: Text that is relevant but less important can be lower-contrast to suggest its' reduced importance.

reverse.$description: Use for typographic content against reversed (inverted theme) surfaces.

secondary.$description: Secondary text color for use against reversed (inverted theme) surfaces.

surface.$description: The primary color of the application surface (background). If interactive, surfaces have a hover and active color.

background.$description: A slightly darker surface gives a receded appearance relative to main surfaces.

subtle.$description: Use when a subtler distinction than the standard surface--background is needed.

reverse.$description: Use a reverse surface to invert the theme when a strong contrast is needed with the rest of the application.

border.$description: Most of our borders should use this color for subtle definition.

interactive.$description: Use for the borders of interactive elements to give greater visual significance and ensure the element meets WCAG contrast standards.

section.$description: Use where other bordered content is being further sectioned, such as table headers or list sections.

overlay.$description: Use to mask an area of the interface to promote focus to a foreground action, such as a Modal's appearance.

dimmed.$description: A dimmed version of Surface, this masks an area of the interface to indicate inactivity (i.e. waiting for updates).

job.$description: Jobs are green because of their core association to Jobber, which has historically used some shade of green for branding.

visit.$description: Visits inherit the green from jobs.

task.$description: Tasks use a deeper shade of blue than invoices and the two rarely share interfaces as tasks are generally isolated to scheduling.

invoice.$description: Invoices are blue as this is a common color associated with banking and finance.

payments.$description: Payments inherit the blue of invoicing.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has request status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a request background.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has quote status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a quote background.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has job status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a job background.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has visit status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a visit background.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has task status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a task background.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has event status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop an event background.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has invoice status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop an invoice background.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has payments status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a payments background.

client.$description: Clients use a neutral value as they sit at the core of the workflow.

surface.$description: Use for the surface of an element that has client status.

onSurface.$description: Use for text or iconography that sits overtop a client background.

shadow.$description: Shadow tokens for the dark theme.
